f.fn: thermal management of electronic devices and systems

e.dn: Effects of Localized Heat Generations Due to the Color Conversion in Phosphor Particles and Layers of High Brightness Light Emitting Diodes
e.d: The efficiency and reliability of the solid-state lighting devices strongly depend on successful thermal management. Light emitting diodes, LEDs, a strong candidate for the next generation general illumination applications are of interest. Typical white LEDs start with either blue or near UV light generated by the active quantum layers. The light is guided through a transparent encapsulant filled with micron sized phosphor particles. The phosphor particles up-convert the short wavelength light to desired colors, producing white light. Due to low quantum efficiency, during the conversion, localized heating of small particles occurs. Experimental results with high brightness LED packages showed that there is significant light output reduction. Idealized numerical models through Finite element technique were created to evaluate the effects of localized heat generations at particles and layers. Results showed that as small as a 3 mW heat generation on a 20 μm diameter spherical phosphor particle might lead to excessive temperatures which can be a major source of light output degradation and reliability concern for high brightness LEDs.Copyright © 2003 by ASME
e.vfn: 2003 International Electronic Packaging Technical Conference and Exhibition, Volume 1

e.dn: White light with UV LEDs
e.d: The advantages of near UV LED chips with phosphors for white light generation are discussed. Recently developed UV LED excitable phosphor blends are presented. Monte Carlo simulations suggest low color point variation (entirely within the first MacAdam oval) for the standard LED chip bin (400-410 nm), compared to high color point variation (outside the fourth MacAdam oval) for the standard bin (460-470 nm) and typical phosphors, modeled as Gaussians of realistic spectral width and targeting the 3000K ANSI color point (x=0.440, y=0.403). A discussion of the full LED package performance is also offered.
e.vfn: Optical Science and Technology, SPIE's 48th Annual Meeting

e.dn: Ce3+-based phosphors for blue LED excitation
e.d: The luminescence of Ce 3+  in host lattices based on Y 3 Al 5 O 12  garnets that can be used in blue LED based solid state lighting sources is discussed. Specifically, the effect of Ga 3+  and Tb 3+  substitution for Al 3+  and Y 3+ , respectively, on the emission color and thermal quenching of these phosphors is described with the initial implications for white light devices.
e.vfn: Optical Science and Technology, SPIE's 48th Annual Meeting

e.d: Es sind ein Verfahren und eine Vorrichtung zur Detektion von Photonen offenbart.   Die Vorrichtung enthalt einen Szintillator-Einkristall und eine Avalanche-Photodiode, die mit dem Szintillator-Einkristall gekoppelt ist.   Der Szintillator-Einkristall ist einer Temperatur von mehr als etwa 175°C und einem Erschutterungsniveau in einem Bereich von etwa 20 Grms bis etwa 30 Grms ausgesetzt.   Der Szintillator-Einkristall enthalt eine Praseodym-dotierte Zusammensetzung, die aus (La  x  Y  1-x  )  2  Si  2  O  7  :Pr, ABCl  3-y  X  y  :Pr, A  2  (Li,Na)LaCl  6-y  X  y  :Pr ausgewahlt ist, oder beliebige Kombinationen von diesen.   Wie hierin verwendet, ist A Casium, Rubidium, Kalium, Natrium oder eine Kombination von diesen, wahrend B Kalzium, Barium, Strontium, Magnesium, Cadmium, Zink oder eine Kombination von diesen ist und X Brom, Jod oder eine Kombination von diesen ist.   Ferner gilt (0 ≤ x < 1) und (0 < y < 3).

e.dn: Pressure-induced Pr 3 þ 3 P0 luminescence in cubic Y2O3
e.d: 3 þ abstract An explanation for the puzzling absence of luminescence from the Pr 3 þ 3 PJ( ¼0,1,2) states in C-Ln2O3 (cubic; Ln 3 þ ¼Lu 3 þ ,Y 3 þ ,G d 3 þ ) family of materials is provided by conducting a study of the emission properties of C-Y2O3:Pr 3 þ under applied hydrostatic pressure. Above 7 GPa, electronic transitions from the Pr 3 þ 3 PJ( ¼0,1,2) states are observed in the emission spectrum of C-Y2O3:Pr 3 þ at room temperature and below. The experimental data reveal that the crystal-field split Pr 3 þ 4f 1 5d 1 configuration is located entirely within the host lattice conduction band and that the promotion of the electron to the Pr 3 þ 4f 1 5d 1 state produces a self-trapped exciton-like state with the configuration, (Pr 4 þ þeCB), where eCB indicates an electron in the host lattice conduction band. Upon excitation, the exciton-like state bypasses the upper emitting 3 PJ( ¼0,1,2) states and directly feeds the lower emitting 1 D2 state. This explains the absence of optical transitions from the Pr 3 þ 3 PJ( ¼0,1,2) states in the emission spectrum of C-Y2O3:Pr 3 þ at ambient pressure. At high pressures, emission transitions from the Pr 3 þ 3 PJ( ¼0,1,2) states are observed because of the localization of the Pr 3 þ 4f 1 5d 1 state to below the host lattice conduction band edge.

Matériau luminescent dopé avec un lanthanide
e.d: L'invention concerne un materiau luminescent comprenant une substance luminescente a base d'aluminate de formule (I) A 1+x Mg 1+y Al 10+z O 17+x+y+i.5z  : Eu 2+ , R 3+ , ou 0 ≤ x ≤ 0,4, 0 ≤ y ≤ 1 et 0 ≤ z ≤ 0,2. A est choisi parmi Ca, Ba et Sr et leurs combinaisons. La substance luminescente a base d'aluminate est dopee avec un ion de lanthanide (R 3+ ) qui existe dans des etats multivalents stables dans le materiau luminescent. R 3+  est choisi parmi Sm 3+ , Yb 3+ , Tm 3+ , Ce 3+ , Tb 3+ , Pr 3+  et leurs combinaisons. Les substances luminescentes a base d'aluminate de formule (I) peuvent etre melangees avec d'autres substances luminescentes bleues, jaunes, orange, vertes et rouges pour donner des melanges de substances luminescentes a lumiere blanche. L'invention concerne egalement un appareil d'eclairage comprenant un tel materiau luminescent. L'appareil d'eclairage comprend une source de lumiere en plus du materiau luminescent.

e.dn: Récupération de terres rares à partir d'un matériau fluorescent et procédé associé
e.d: L'invention porte sur un procede de recuperation d'un constituant a base de terres rares a partir d'une substance luminescente. Le procede comprend un certain nombre d'etapes (a) a (d). Dans l'etape (a), la substance luminescente est cuite avec un materiau alcalin dans des conditions suffisantes pour decomposer la substance luminescente en un melange d'oxydes. Un residu contenant des oxydes de terres rares est extrait du melange dans l'etape (b). Dans l'etape (c), le residu est traite pour obtenir une solution, laquelle comprend les constituants a base de terres rares sous forme de sel. Les constituants a base de terres rares sont separes de la solution dans l'etape (d).

e.dn: Optical Spectroscopy of YI3-Nd3+: Charge Transfer Transition and Efficient Visible Emission
The Luminescence of Octahedrally Coordinated Divalent Europium in Cs2M2+P2O7(M = Ca, Sr)
NEXT GENERATION ENERGY EFFICIENT FLUORESCENT LIGHTING PRODUCT
e.d: This is the Final Report of the Next-Generation Energy Efficient Fluorescent Lighting Products program, Department of Energy (DOE). The overall goal of this three-year program was to develop novel phosphors to improve the color rendition and efficiency of compact and linear fluorescent lamps. The prime technical approach was the development of quantum-splitting phosphor (QSP) to further increase the efficiency of conventional linear fluorescent lamps and the development of new high color rendering phosphor blends for compact fluorescent lamps (CFLs) as potential replacements for the energy-hungry and short-lived incandescent lamps in market segments that demand high color rendering light sources. We determined early in the project that the previously developed oxide QSP, SrAl{sub 12}O{sub 19}:Pr{sup 3+}, did not exhibit an quantum efficiency higher than unity under excitation by 185 nm radiation, and we therefore worked to determine the physical reasons for this observation. From our investigations we concluded that the achievement of quantum efficiency exceeding unity in SrAl{sub 12}O{sub 19}:Pr{sup 3+} was not possible due to interaction of the Pr{sup 3+} 5d level with the conduction band of the solid. The interaction which gives rise to an additional nonradiative decay path for the excitation energy is responsible for the low quantum efficiency of the phosphor. Our work has led to the development of a novel spectroscopic method for determining photoionzation threshold of luminescent centers in solids. This has resulted in further quantification of the requirements for host phosphor lattice materials to optimize quantum efficiency. Because of the low quantum efficiency of the QSP, we were unable to demonstrate a linear fluorescent lamp with overall performance exceeding that of existing mercury-based fluorescent lamps. Our work on the high color rendering CFLs has been very successful. We have demonstrated CFLs that satisfies the EnergyStar requirement with color rendering index (CRI) greater than 90; the CRI of current commercial CFLs are in the low 80s. In this report we summarize the technical work completed under the Program, summarize our findings about the performance limits of the various technologies we investigated, and outline promising paths for future work.

matériaux scintillants, objets les utilisant et leurs procédés d'utilisation
e.d: La presente invention concerne des materiaux scintillants, des procedes pour leur fabrication et un procede pour leur utilisation. Dans un mode de realisation, un scintillateur comprend la formule A2LnBX6, dans laquelle A comprend le thallium (Tl), un element du Groupe IA et des combinaisons comprenant au moins un parmi ce qui precede, Ln comprend le cerium, B comprend un element du Groupe IA et X comprend l'iode (I) ou un compose iode, le compose iode comprenant l'iode (I) et un element choisi dans le groupe consistant en fluorure (F), chlorure (Cl), bromure (Br) et des combinaisons comprenant au moins un parmi ce qui precede. L'invention concerne egalement les detecteurs de rayonnement et leurs procedes d'utilisation.

e.dn: Method And Apparatus For Determining Health Of Thermal Barrier Coatings
e.d: A method for determining past-service conditions and/or remaining useful life of a component of a combustion engine and/or a thermal barrier coating ("TBC") of the component comprises providing a photoluminescent ("PL") material in the TBC, directing an exciting radiation at the TBC, measuring the intensity of a characteristic peak in the emission spectrum of the PL material, and correlating the intensity of the characteristic peak or another quantity derived therefrom to an amount of a new phase that has been formed as a result of the exposure of the component to extreme temperatures. An apparatus for carrying out the method comprises a radiation source that provides the exciting radiation to the TBC, a radiation detector for detecting radiation emitted by the PL material, and means for relating a characteristic of the emission spectrum of the PL material to the amount of the new phase in the TBC, thereby inferring the past-service conditions or the remaining useful life of the component.

Scintillator compositions of cerium halides
e.d: A scintillator composition containing a solid solution of at least two cerium halides. A radiation detector for detecting high-energy radiation is also described . The detector includes the scintillator composition mentioned above, along with a photodetector optically coupled to the scintillator. A method for detecting high-energy radiation with a scintillation detector is also described, wherein the scintillation crystal is based on a mixture of cerium halides.

The detector includes the aforementioned scintillator comprising a photodetector which is optically coupled to the scintillator.  A method for detecting high-energy radiation with a scintillation detector, wherein the scintillation crystal is based on a mixture of Cerhalogeniden is also described.

Dispositif d'eclairage a diodes electroluminescentes a motif au phosphore multicouche
e.d: L'invention concerne un procede permettant d'appliquer au moins deux luminophores a une diode electroluminescente (DEL). Un premier materiau luminophore presentant une absorption inferieure, une duree de decroissance de la luminescence plus breve, et/ou un refroidissement thermique plus faible qu'un second materiau luminophore, est place plus pres de la DEL que le second luminophore. Une telle disposition produit un dispositif illuminant d'un rendement lumineux et d'une stabilite des couleurs ameliores sur une gamme de courants d'attaque.

e.dn: Compositions de scintillateur, procédés correspondants, et articles de fabrication
Phosphor blend having a phosphor containing boron and rare-earth metals, methods of making and light sources incorporating the same
e.d: A phosphor blend comprising (a) a phosphor having a formula of AB3O6:Ce, Mn; wherein A is at least a rare-earth metal other than cerium; (b) a red light-emitting phosphor; and (c) a blue light-emitting phosphor. The phosphor blend can be used in light sources and displays. Also shown is methods for making the phosphor having a formula of AB3O6:Ce, Mn.

e.d: a light source (12) to produce radiation having a length exceeding 510 nm;  and an enclosure (14) surrounding an area generating radiation light source to surround at least substantially radiation, the enclosure comprising: a side;  a first portion which is substantially reflective of the radiation, and at least a second part comprising a portion (32) of phosphorus in a removable and interchangeable (30) top panel that fits into an opening (50) in an upper enclosure, the second portion being spaced from the radiation generating area of ​​the light source, the phosphor portion comprising: a radiation receiving surface and emitting surface to deliver visible light.

e.dn: Procede et appareil pour systemes de lampes a panneau de diodes electroluminescentes
e.d: Un appareil d'eclairage (10) comporte un moteur lumineux (12) produisant un rayonnement ultraviolet. Une enceinte (14) entoure une zone de generation de rayonnement du moteur lumineux (12) pour englober le rayonnement. Au moins une paroi (28) de l'enceinte (14) est concue pour reflechir sensiblement le rayonnement ultraviolet. L'enceinte (14) inclut une partie superieure remplacable (30) qui inclut une partie a luminophore (32). La partie a luminophore (32) est espacee de la zone de generation du rayonnement du moteur lumineux (12) d'une distance egale a la hauteur de l'enceinte (14).

e.dn: Phosphore rouge fonce pour applications generales d'eclairage
e.d: L'invention concerne un dispositif d'emission de lumiere comprenant une source de lumiere semi-conductrice d'ultraviolets et un melange de phosphores contenant un phosphore emettant du bleu, un phosphore emettant du vert et un phosphore emettant du rouge fonce qui renferment (Ba,Sr,Ca)3MgxSi2O8:Eu2+, 1<_x<_2. Cette invention a aussi trait a un melange de phosphores contenant un phosphore emettant du bleu, un phosphore emettant du vert et un phosphore emettant du rouge qui renferment (Ba,Sr,Ca)3MgxSi2O8:Eu2.

Phosphores grenats contenant du terbium a large spectre et sources de lumiere blanche comprenant lesdits phosphores
e.d: L'invention concerne un phosphore grenat contenant du terbium, active par terres rares, pouvant absorber un rayonnement sur l'echelle allant de l'UV proche au bleu, et emettre un large spectre de lumiere visible sur l'echelle comprise entre environ 490 nm et environ 770 nm. L'emission de ce phosphore sous une excitation de 450 nm presente un pic se situant sur l'echelle de sensibilite maximum de l'oeil humain. Une source de lumiere associant une DEL UV/bleue et ce phosphore peut produire une lumiere blanche qui se situe sur le lieu des corps noirs ou a proximite de celui-ci, et qui peut etre utile pour l'eclairage general.

Dispositif electroluminescent avec composition au phosphore
e.d: L'invention concerne une source lumineuse comprenant une composition au phosphore et un dispositif electroluminescent tel qu'une diode electroluminescente ou laser. La composition au phosphore absorbe le rayonnement presentant un premier spectre et emet un rayonnement presentant un second spectre et comprend au moins un de: YBO3:Ce3+,Tb3+; BaMgAl?10?O17:Eu?2+, Mn2+?; (Sr,Ca,Ba)(Al,Ga)?2?S4:Eu?2+?; et Y?3?Al5O12-Ce?3+?; et au moins un de: Y?2?O2S:Eu?3+,Bi3+; YVO?4:Eu3+,Bi3+; SrS:Eu2+; SrY2S4:Eu2+; CaLa?2?S4:Ce?3+?; et (Ca,Sr)S:Eu2+. Ensemble, la composition au phosphore et la source lumineuse peuvent produire de la lumiere blanche presentant d'agreables caracteristiques, telles qu'une temperature de couleur de 3000-6500 °K, un indice de rendu des couleurs d'environ 83-87, et un rendement lumineux de dispositif d'environ 10-20 lumens par watt.

e.dn: Fluorescent Lamp Phosphors Fluorescent Lamp Phosphors
e.d: luorescent lamp phosphors convert the ultraviolet emission of a rare-gas/mercury discharge plasma into visible (white) light. The phosphor is responsible for nearly all the visible light produced by the lamp with the visible mercury lines contributing only a few percent to the total lamp light output. This article reviews fluorescent lamp phosphors that are used in general purpose illumination. Readers interested in applications of phosphor in specialized fluorescent lamp products such as skin-tanning lamps, germicidal lamps, lamps used in photocopiers, to name a few, are encouraged to consult References 1 and 2. The article begins with an overview of fluorescent lamp use, construction, and operation, and proceeds with an overview of fluorescent lamp phosphors. Finally, comments on the energy and environmental issues associated with the use of fluorescent lamp products in residential and commercial markets are made. General-purpose lighting consumes about one-quarter of all electricity produced in the United States. The incandescent lamp, where a filament of
